contexts.context: Contexts for chart items identified by Actuate, 06/2009

context.title: Area Format
context.description:
The plot area of a chart with axes includes the axes and the area within the axes.
The plot area of a chart without axes, such as a pie or meter chart, includes the client area, which contains the chart.

topic.label: How to modify the plot area

context.title: Custom Properties
context.description:
A custom property associates a value or expression with each instance of a chart. Use a custom property in an event handler to modify the default behavior of a chart.
To add a custom property, type a name in the text box below the list of custom properties. Then, choose Add Next, type a value or expression to set the initial value of the custom property.
To use the custom property in an event handler, write code similar to the following line:
chart.getExtendedProperties().get(0).getValue()

context.title: General Properties
context.description:
General properties define the standard features for the current chart type.
You can use the general properties in an event handler by calling the chart's getter methods.

context.title: Curve Fitting Line
context.description:
A curve fitting line displays a curve that passes through all the points on a chart with axes. You use this line to estimate the values between those that appear on the chart.
On Curve Fitting Line, set the appearance of the line. You can add a title to the line, with an optional outline.

context.title: Series Labels
context.description: Series labels display values related to the point on the chart. For example, you can show the percentage of the total that the point represents.

topic.label: Refine the chart appearance

context.title: Filters
context.description:
A filter restricts the set of records to include in a chart. A filter does not restrict the set of records in the data set itself. For example, you can create filters to select customers in a certain region, or customers with a certain credit rank.
Choose Add to add a new filter.
Filters are applied in the order that they appear in the list. If you have more than one filter, you can choose Up or Down to reorder the selected filter.

context.title: Parameters
context.description:
A parameter restricts the set of records in a data set based on the value of an individual field. If a data set provides a parameter, you can set a value or expression to define the records that you require. The value or expression must return a value of the correct data type for the field from the data set.
If a data set does not provide parameters, you can restrict the values that the chart displays by using Filter.

context.title: Hyperlink Options
context.description: A hyperlink can link a part of a chart to a web site, another location within the same report, or a location within a different report.

topic.label: How to create a hyperlink that links two sections in a report

context.title: Expression Builder - Specify Data Definition
context.description: Create expressions using a combination of constants, controls, functions, literal values, names of fields, and operators that evaluate to a single value.

topic.label: Scripting Reference
Writing Expressions

context.title: Externalize Text
context.description: Externalizing text supports localization of static string values into multiple languages.

topic.label: Scripting Reference

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Chart Area
context.description: The chart area includes the plot area, the title area, the legend area, and the axes if the chart uses axes.

topic.label: Refine the chart appearance
Change the chart title
How to set a chart's background color

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Axis
context.description: A chart axis can display ticks, labels, and a title to inform a user about the values on the chart.

topic.label: How to set the data type and format of an axis

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Legend
context.description: A chart legend displays a key of category colors and names to assist a user in interpreting chart values.

topic.label: Refine the chart appearance

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Plot
context.description:
The plot area of a chart with axes includes the axes and the area within the axes.
The plot area of a chart without axes, such as a pie or meter chart, includes the client area, which contains the chart.

topic.label: How to modify the plot area
How to set a chart's background color

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Series
context.description:
A series is a set of related values.
On a chart with axes, category series relate to the x-axis and value series map to the y-axis.
On a pie chart, a slice appears for each item in a category series. The value series sets the size of each slice.
You can set general series properties, such as title, visibility, and the set of colors to use for slices and bars.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: X-Axis
context.description:
The x-axis displays values for a category series. Its values can be of any data type.
Use this page to specify title, type, position of the x-axis with respect to the y-axis, and labels.
For additional formatting options, choose Scale, Title, Label, Gridlines, Markers, and Interactivity.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Category Series
context.description:
The category series determines the number of slices in a pie chart. Its values can be of any data type.
To combine the slices for categories having values below a threshold into a single slice, type a value in Minimum Slice. Then, in Slice Label, type text to use as the category label for the combined slice.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Value (Y) Series, Bar Charts
context.description:
The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types.
Use this page to format the bars and bar outlines in the chart.
Note that you can select "Show Curve Fitting Line" to add a curve fitting line in addition to the bars.
Use the Labels, Interactivity, and Series Palette buttons to further refine the formatting of the value series.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Value (Y) Series, Area Charts
context.description:
The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types.
Use this page to format the properties of the "value" series (y axis) of the chart.
Note that you can select "Show Lines as Curves" to curve the line between data points, and "Show Curve Fitting Line" to add a curve fitting line to the chart.
Use the Labels, Interactivity, and Series Palette buttons to further refine the formatting of the value series.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Value (Y) Series, Line Charts
context.description:
The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types.
Use this page to format the properties of the "value" series (y axis) of the chart.
Note that you can select "Show Lines as Curves" to replace straight lines between data points with curves, and "Show Curve Fitting Line" to add a curve fitting line to the chart.
Use the Labels, Interactivity, and Series Palette buttons to further refine the formatting of the value series.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Value (Y) Series, Scatter Charts
context.description:
The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be of numeric, date, or date-and-time types.
Use this page to format the properties of the "value" series (y axis) of the chart, including markers and lines.
Note that you can select "Show Lines as Curves" to use curved lines between data points, and "Show Curve Fitting Line" to add a curve fitting line to the chart.
Use the Labels, Interactivity, and Series Palette buttons to further refine the formatting of the value series.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Value (Y) Series, Stock Charts
context.description:
The y-axis displays values for a value series. Its values must be numeric.
Use this page to format the properties of the "value" series of the chart, including box color and candlestick line properties.
Use the Interactivity and Series Palette buttons to further refine the formatting of the value series.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Value Series, Pie Charts
context.description: The value series determines the size of slices in a pie chart. Its values must be numeric.

topic.label: Refine the chart appearance

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Value Series, Meter Charts
context.description:
The value series determines the position of the needle in a meter chart. Its values must be numeric.
Use this page to format the properties of the "value" series of the chart, including the configuration of the dial and the needle.
Use the Dial Labels, Needles, Regions, Ticks, Scale, and Interactivity buttons to further refine the formatting of the value series.

context.title: Edit Format
context.description: Use this dialog box to define a format for the selected Data Type.

topic.label: Refine the chart appearance

context.title: Gridlines
context.description: Use this dialog box to display or hide the selected axis line and gridlines that run parallel to the axis. Use it also to customize their appearance.

context.title: Interactivity
context.description: Use this dialog box to define interactive features of your chart, both the types of interactivity and the actions that trigger the interactive responses.

topic.label: How to create a hyperlink that links two sections in a report

context.title: Legend Layout
context.description: Use this page to format the legend for the chart.

context.title: Markers
context.description:
Use this dialog box to create axis markers, define marker position and other marker properties, and define marker label properties. Markers can be single lines or ranges, and call attention to a specific location on the axis.
Select a marker in the text box to work with its definition.
You can you can access additional formatting options by choosing the buttons to the right of the Value and Font fields.

context.title: New Data Set
context.description: Use this dialog box to define a data set for charting.

topic.label: Build a data set

context.title: Outline
context.description:
Use this dialog box to indicate whether you want to frame the chart with a visible outline, and to specify the properties of the outline.
Specify insets to adjust the padding between chart and outline.
The default unit for specifying insets is points. To change the default units, from the New Chart of Edit Chart dialog box, choose Format Chart, then Chart Area, then General Properties.

topic.label: How to set a chart's background color

context.title: Scale
context.description:
Use this dialog box to set the minimum and maximum values displayed on a numerical axis.
For both numerical and non-numerical axes, you can set the number of minor, or secondary, gridlines displayed for each unit on the axis.
Note: If the minor gridlines are not displayed, choose Gridlines, then select Visible for Minor Grid.

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Select Data
context.description:
Use this page to select a data set, or choose Create New to open the New Data Set dialog box.
Bind data colums to the chart by selecting a series field, by using the expression builder, or by dragging the column head to the appropriate field.
In a Bubble chart, the values in the third data series specify the size of the bubbles. In a Difference chart, the values in the positive and negative series appear with a color band between them.

topic.label: Provide data for a chart
Displaying Data in Charts

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Select Chart Type
context.description:
Use this page to specify the type of chart you want.
All chart types can be fine-tuned using this page. Some have sub-types, some can be displayed in three dimensions, and some can be displayed as "deep" charts (charts with a three-dimensional appearance, but conveying no additional information in the third dimension). Some charts permit you to add another axis.
You can also specify the output format for the chart.
Note: If you select an output format that your system does not support, you will not be able to open the Select Data page.
Choose Finish to save your selections.

topic.label: Add the chart to the report
Creating a standalone chart

context.title: Series Palette
context.description: Use this dialog box to select colors for members of the series. Double-click a bar to display the options.

context.title: Edit Font
context.description:
Use this dialog box to format the font for a text item. When you change a font option, the change is displayed in the Preview text box.
You can set the orientation of the text item either by dragging the Rotation dial or by specifying degrees.

topic.label: Refine the chart appearance

context.title: Text Format
context.description:
Use this dialog box to customize text format.
This dialog box is used to format text for many chart elements. The fields that are available for input depend on the element that you are working with.

topic.label: How to format an axis title

context.title: Title Format
context.description:
Use this dialog box to format the title area and the title text.
You can define outlines for both title and title area, and also specify inset values to increase the blank space around the element.
If you want to change the title font, choose ... next to Format.

topic.label: How to format an axis title

context.title: Preferences: Chart
context.description: Use this page to enable or disable interactive chart previews as you modify the chart definition. Use it also to set the maximum number of rows in the chart data preview on the Select Data page of the chart builder.

topic.label: How to change chart preview preferences

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Z-Axis
context.description:
Use this page to specify the title of the z-axis, and to specify whether the labels are visible.
For additional formatting options, choose Text Format, Gridlines, and Interactivity.
Note that if you want the z-axis title to be displayed, you may have to choose Text Format and select Visible.

context.title: Series Markers
context.description: Use this dialog box to add and remove line markers in your chart.

context.title: Regions
context.description: Use this dialog box to add and remove regions in your chart, and to specify the properties of the regions that you add.

context.title: Select Data Binding
context.description:
Use this dialog box to bind data to columns, and to specify aggregations.
Note that you can also bind data in the Select Data page by dragging and dropping.

topic.label: Binding Data

context.title: Gradient Editor
context.description: Use this dialog box to specify the starting and ending colors for gradual background color changes, and to specify the orientation of the gradient.

topic.label: How to set a chart's background color

context.title: Select Image
context.description: Use this dialog box to select an image for the chart background.

topic.label: How to set a chart's background color

context.title: Format Chart Area Background
context.description: Use this dialog box to format the chart background. For the additional options, graduated color, custom color, and images, choose the appropriate buttons.

topic.label: How to set a chart's background color

context.title: Color
context.description: Use this dialog box to select the background color for the chart.

topic.label: How to set a chart's background color

context.title: Edit Chart and New Chart: Y-Axis
context.description:
Use this page to specify title, type, and position of the y-axis with respect to the x-axis.
For additional formatting options, choose Scale, Text Format, Gridlines, and Markers.
Note that if you want the y-axis title to be displayed, you may have to choose Text Format and select Visible.

context.title: Format Chart Title
context.description: Use this page to replace the default title, such as Bar Chart Title, with a name for your chart. You can specify a font for the title or accept the default font.

topic.label: Change the chart title

context.title: Format Gantt Chart
context.description:
Use this page to format a Gantt chart. Gantt charts often represent project schedules and tasks using bars that correlate to beginning and ending dates. You can color-code the bars to show status, for example.
You can specify any number of Gantt series and a set of categories that represent the top-level project or task names. Each Gantt series represents start date, end date, and subtask name for each category.
With multiple Gantt series, for each category that represents the main task, you can have multiple sub-tasks, each being one series, and starting and ending on different dates.

context.title: Format Bubble Chart Y Series
context.description: Use this page to format a bubble chart, which is basically a scatter plot with a third value that is used to size the bubble. You can specify the style and orientation of the acceleration line to the bubble. From this page, you can choose Markers to specify any marker type that is available to the line and scatter charts. The default marker type of the chart is circular.

context.title: Chart Title Text
context.description: Use this dialog to change the background and shadow of the text in the chart title from transparent, the default, to another color. Also specify the style, width, and color of the title text outline, and its visibility. Pad the chart title text to control the spacing between it and the chart by using insets.

topic.label: How to format an axis title

context.title: Title Layout
context.description: The title block is the modular area of the title that can be positioned within the title bounds. Select an Anchor location to position the chart title at the top, bottom, left, or right side of the chart. In Stretch, you can specify how the content of the block fills up available space, horizontally, vertically, or in both directions. Also specify the style, width, and color of the title block outline, and its visibility. Pad the chart title block to control the spacing between it and the chart by using insets.

context.title: Chart Legend Title
context.description: Use this dialog to make a title for the chart legend. By default, the title appears above the legend items. You can modify the font style and the color of the title, add an outline, background color, shadow, or move the position of the legend title.

topic.label: How to format an axis title

context.title: Chart Legend Block
context.description: The legend block is the modular area of a legend that can be positioned within the legend bounds. Use this dialog to change the font style and size of the legend text. You can also add an outline, background color, or shadow to the legend text. Control the spacing of the legend by using insets. If the chart uses more than one series, you can add a separator line between the items in one series and the items in the next. You can control the visibility of legend text outlines and separators using this dialog.

context.title: Dial Labels
context.description:
A meter chart displays labels, similar to axis labels, that identify points on a dial. Use this dialog to format the font, background color, and shadow of the dial labels. Create a visible or invisible outline around each dial label. Pad labels to control the spacing between them by using insets. The Format option sets the numbering format of the dial labels.
You show or hide the dial labels themselves in Format Chart.

topic.label: How to format an axis title

context.title: Dial Needles
context.description:
Use this dialog to modify the appearance of the needle for a meter chart. You can specify the following characteristics of the needle:
-- line style: solid, dashed, dash-dot, or dot -- line width in points -- needle head style: either solid, none, or circle
To change the color of the needle, change the value-series palette.

context.title: Grouping and Sorting
context.description: Use this dialog to sort and group chart data. You can group up to two levels along the x-axis, for example by year and months. You can group by date-time and range. You can group multiple Y aggregates for X series grouping, where each Y series can use its own aggregate function. You can group multiple Y series grouping, where each Y series can have its own grouping key. You can group along the linear axis for Line, Bar, Area charts that are not stacked. You can scale datetime and integers and customize steps numbering.

topic.label: How to group categories on the x-axis

context.title: Format Difference Chart Y Series
context.description: Use this page to format a difference chart, which displays two related line plots with a colored band between them. - Select the format and color of the line to display for the positive and negative series. - Select Show Lines as Curves to display the lines as curves. If you deselect this item, the lines are displyed as straight lines between adjacent values. - To display series labels, select Show Series Labels, then choose Series Labels. - Choose Positive Markers or Negative to specify any marker type that is available to the line and scatter charts. The default marker type of the chart is none. - Choose Interactivity to specify an action to perform for a mouse event.

context.title: Chart Examples
context.description: Use this page to access Charting API examples, including Java code for building several chart types using the Chart Engine API. Select an example to see a preview of the type of chart it constructs. Select Open to see the Java snippet in the code window. You can copy the code if you want. Save the XML code and study it to learn how to create such a chart using the API.

context.title: Preferences - Chart Content Assist page
context.description: Use this page to control the behavior of the content assist tool in the chart builder. Content assist is available in fields for which you supply an expression. Use it to insert an expression in a field.

context.title: Preferences - Chart Field Assist page
context.description: Use this page to control the behavior of field assist in the chart builder. You can choose whether or not to identify required fields with a symbol. You can also specify the position of the symbol relative to the field.
